column5: Are there any bait shops in the Red Lake area that have frozen salted minnows?
none that i'm aware of, up here we use live minnows, but the Sobeys grocery store has containers of frozen shiners (but they are very small shiners)

I've been going to Red Lake for years and have never found a bait shop that sells salted minnows. One year we brought up flash frozen minnows and the fish never bit on them. Live bait is the way to go. We fish Gull Rock and have always had great success using live minnows and leaches.

We caught walleyes on bare jig heads last May. No minnow, no piece of meat, no piece of worm, no grub. Lift the jig 3 or 4 feet off the bottom and pick up big pike every once in a while. We couldn't keep them off. Walleyes in the Red Lake area are aggressive and they are hungry.
